uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.impl

Class HashMapCacheService

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.impl.HashMapCacheService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheService, Service

    public class HashMapCacheService
extends Object
implements CacheService
    A HashMapCacheService is a simple implementation of a CacheService that simply caches the objects in a ConcurrentHashMap. By default the cache is static so it will be shared across the same JVM.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> add(AddCacheRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        Adds a record to the cache according to the contents of the AddCacheRequest parameter. The AddCacheRequest will contain a identifier that is unique per client request for data and therefore it is a good candidate for a lookup key.
        Specified by:
        add in interface CacheService
        Parameters:
        request - AddCacheRequest containing a unique requestId and the information to be cached.
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture which would be true once the information has been cached.

      • get

        public CompletableFuture<DataRequestConfig> get(GetCacheRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: CacheService
        Pull out of the cache the information related to the unique requestId contained in the GetCacheRequest parameter. This method should not remove the item from cache just because it has been retrieved once. There may be many requests to get the cached data instigated my the many data services that are accessing subsets of the list of resource stemming from the single registered data request.
        Specified by:
        get in interface CacheService
        Parameters:
        request - GetCacheRequest containing the unique requestId.
        Returns:
        The DataRequestConfig relating to the unique requestId that is stored in the cache.
